metadata.title: Geometry workshop with muffled audio
metadata.description: Low microphone quality leads to suppressed guidance prompts despite topical discussion.
metadata.goal: Students justify interior angle sums for polygons.
metadata.subject: math
metadata.driftNotes: Input quality remains below thresholds; harness should flag confidence gate.

transcript.text: If each triangle has one hundred eighty degrees, what about a pentagon?
I think we split it into triangles again.
Three triangles makes five hundred forty degrees total.
The recording sounds fuzzy, can you repeat that value?
Five hundred forty degrees because three triangles.
Check the polygon formula to be sure.
It says one hundred eighty times the number of sides minus two.
Right, the answer matches even if audio is rough.
